Team Fortress Classic is the predecessor of the Free to Play game we all know and love, Team Fortress 2. It is a team-based FPS very much like TF2. It was originally a mod based on the 1996 game Quake and was eventually adopted by Valve to be it's own game in 1999. Hell, this game is as old as I am. Runnin on the Source engine, this game is one of, if not, the best game Valve has ever made. It's gameplay of having classes is what makes it stand out from the rest of the FPS games we all see nowadays. It has changed the gaming world and still is to this day with TF2. There are games out there like Battleborn and Overwatch that take on the class-based approach to FPS's, but none of them can compare to Team Fortress. If you're a die-hard Valve fan such as myself, then you NEED to buy yourself a copy of this staple in FPS gaming history!

A decently fun game and a cool look at what Team Fortress 2 could have been. Not really worth buying though because TF2 basically improves on this game in almost every way and has a much, MUCH larger player base (this one almost requires the installation of bots). Maybe a good idea if you want a really cheap game to mess around in but why would you choose this over TF2 that's as cheap as it is anyway?
Неплохая игра. По-моему, даже лучше TF2. Жаль она почти умерла и всего несколько серверов.
Defassado para a nossa epoca, mais um dos melhores mods para half life 1
10/10 would fortress with team classicaly again

I fucking love this game. Its gameplay is simple in nature and will be fairly recognizable to any TF2 players like myself. It's community is small but loving and you can just join a normal server and have fun for a few hours. The classes are the same as in its sequel but have differences to them. Although the gameplay is fairly simple the more complicated aspects of the game are hidden from the player, if you want to, ask a more experienced player about tips and tricks. I thought I should add I bought this game as part of the Half-life: Anthology bundle during the summer sales, so i did not buy it for the sake of owning it.

I definitlely recommend this classic old-school game. This is what I grew up with, and TF2 is another story. So yeah. I'm a big fan of GoldSrc games, and every retro gamer like me should have this. I spent most hours in WON version of this, and now I'm now spending more in Steam version. In conclusion - this is perfect game when it comes to old-school multiplayer.

L'ancétre du Fps cartoon le plus connu de tout les temps 

Ce jeu est un remake du mode de Quake : Team Fortress réalisé avec le Development Kit public d'Half Life 

On y retrouve les neufs classes avec chacune leur particularité mais dans un style rétro beaucoup plus sérieux et tactique que la suite que nous connaissons tous 

Voici d'ailleurs certains points qui pourraient aider les joueurs un peu perdu par rapport à certaines mécaniques: 

-Les techniciens peuvent réparer votre armure 
-L'empoisonnement de l'Infirmier peut-être soigné par un infirmier de votre équipe 
-Un tir de sniper dans les jambes ralentiras considérablement un ennemi , donc si vous voyez un scout s'enfuir avec votre drapeau : Visez les gambettes ! 
-Le Lance Flamme du Pyro ne fait pas beaucoup de dégâts directement, inutile de gaspiller votre énergie et vos munitions, contentez vous de mettre les ennemis en feu et laissez les brûlures faire le travail

Les quelques défauts qu'on pourrait relever seraient certains armes beaucoup trop faibles comme le fusil de chasse et les grenades (qui sont variés et intéressantes sur le papier mais beaucoup trop de joueurs en abusent, c'est d'ailleurs pour ça qu'elles ont été retiré de Team Fortress 2) 

Le jeu est en fait plus coopératif et malin qu'on pourrait le croire 
Et disons que contrairement à sa suite il est encore jouable (c'est pas sur celui là que vous allez vous faire emmerder par des hackers XP)

[h1]Team Fortress Classic Review[/h1]
[b]by KTMboyz[/b]

[i]"Let me explain..."[/i]

Okay!  Yes, I don't recommend the game, why?  Well, that's what I'm going to talk about.  Can I start by pointing out that the game is dead!  You will be lucky enough to find a match with 1 to 5 people on it.  "But, that's just because its old!  Surely it was a popular and fun game at the time?" I hear you say.  Well, in a way.  Team Fortress Classic was overshadowed by the monster hit:  Counter-Strike.  If you compare the two, Team Fortress Classic is a mess...  Unlike its sequel, the characters are not memorable, the weapons sound terrible in my opinion and so on...  When I do find a game, its actually pretty fun...  Sometimes...?  I don't know, this is my opinion and I personally feel like the game is not very polished and seems unfinished.  I will point out I haven't even played for two hours XD, so my opinion might change.  Pick it up if you liked the game or have lots of memories from before.  If your some TF2/CoD kid looking for another game, well, probably not...  Sorry.

[h1]8.5/10[/h1]

A primeira vez que joguei, o jogo se apresentou meio confuso, pois os servidores são normalmente frequentados por players experientes, e que sabem utilizar ao máximo as habilidades dos diferentes tipos de personagem. PORÉM, depois de algumas partidas descobri que era pura falta de habilidade, e que o jogo requer prática para ser aproveitado ao máximo. Tives péssimos e ótimos momentos no TFC, mas creio que todos foram causados pela minha falta de familiriadade inicial. 

Querendo ou não, TFC é um dos pais do estilo de jogos interessantes como Overwatch e o gratuito Dirty Bomb.

Se você é habituado a jogos clássicos de FPS como eu, já é um ótimo passo para a o desenvolvimento de estrategias no gameplay. Na minha opinião é uma boa compra, estiloso, clássico, estratégico, porém não muito "casual".

As a TF2 player, I can tell you that TFC is far from it, but at the same time as close to Tf2 as twins. Something that makes it different is that it definitely requires a lot of skill, I mean a lot. You also need to remember to pick up on what you need to do and what exactly is going on. Unlike TF2, the information isn't always right up in your face. You almost always have to have a strategy otherwise you'll be dead really quickly. Oh yeah, and grenades.
There are a lot of elements of this game that tells you that this is, without a doubt, the father of TF2. Something most notable and most obvious is how fast paced they both are. Seriously, first 2 minutes of any game from both of these titles has more action then a James Bond movie on steroids most the time. Another thing I'd like to point out is that over the years, the classes still have almost the exact same elements and still have the same purpose (With probably the exception of pyro, but that's debatable.) It's suprising to see that even after all that's been added to TF2 and how much you may think that it's not close to it's orgin, but really, Everything you had from the first is pretty much right there (Other than 'nades XD).

I seriously recomend this game and I aplaud the community that supports it. Even though it's old, it's probably one of the best games you could find on steam. It deserves a lot more attention. And in my opinion, It's certainly worth $4.99.

This is a good game. Pretty fun to play. The enemies maybe are a little bit overpowered when it comes to health,
and you could just be killed before you know what's even hit you. There's not any microtransactions, which
a good game doen't need. It's pretty simple, which comes with no surprise considering this game is made in the late 90's.
But with all other flaws aside, i recommend it.

As much as I would love to enjoy this game, I find a few things wrong with it:

1. Although I think many of you will disagree, it is very repetitive. Why? Because it is not getting any updates. If you do not like repetitiveness, just play team fortress 2.

2. I feel like it's missing a lot of color and textures. I mean, compared to the other half-life 1 games, I feel like this is just missing that.

and 3. (This goes along with repetitiveness) You are only stuck with certain weapons. Unlike Team Fortress 2, where you can change weapons from classes, and half life, where you can have multiple weapons at at time. I just feel like this is something wrong with this game as well

I feel like I'm going to get alot of hate for this review, but this is my opinion.

Team Fortress Classic is a really good game, hop on it every so often but I cannot recommend it for most people. Why? Because it's so difficult to understand. There is no feedback and its so hard to tell whats going on in matches because its so fast paced. Its hard to explain but if you try it yourself you will know exactly what I mean. Experienced players get a huge advantage over everyone especially with grenades in the game. The learning curve is so steep that it's not even a curve... It's a wall... 

However if you're good at games like quake or half-life then I defilently recommend this!!!

Один из наиболее популярных онлайновых экшенов всех времен — Team Fortress Classic — предлагает десять классов персонажей: от Медика, до Шпиона и Подрывника, вовлеченных в уникальную по стилю командную войну. Каждый класс располагает уникальными оружием, снаряжением и способностями. Команды противостоят друг другу в онлайне в различных игровых режимах.
Моя оценка 10/10.

Team Fortress Classic is a complete joy. At first it's a hard game to jump into and can be quite annoying from time to time. There are many things that make this game what it is.

First off, this game set the standard for what every class-based shooter should be. From the fast-running scout to the hefty Heavy Weapons Guy, this game introduces most-needed diversity in what any game should have to keep it running, and to keep players playing. Sometimes, however, it just doesn't seem like the classes are doing what they should. On maps like 2fort (CTF) or Dustbowl (TC), the Medics are the ones that are the guys pushing the flag by using their frag and concussion grenades to propel themselves towards the capture point, rendering the Scout useless and completely diverts the MEDIC'S role away from what it seems.

The game play of this game will keep you sitting at your desk for hours on hours. The on-going struggle to carry a piece of cloth on a pole to an enemy base will be as if you're running with a piece of pie dangling in front of you -- Long and annoying at first, but rewarding in the end. The stalemates of the grenade tosses at the beginning of matches can be aggravating, but you'll feel like a secret agent slipping through as a spy.

Overall, this game is absolutely marvelous, and will live on forever. This game is worth the five bucks, it's tons of fun, and it will keep you entertained for years to come.
